## Setup on a Mac

If you want to run RNetLogo in headless mode (without GUI, i.e. setting argument gui=FALSE in NLStart) you have to disable AWT before loading the package. Just execute Sys.setenv(NOAWT=1) before executing `library(RNetLogo)`. 

If you want to run RNetLogo in GUI mode you have to start it from the JGR application (see https://cran.r-project.org/package=JGR and the note at http://groups.yahoo.com/group/netlogo-users/message/14817).

It can be necessary to run Sys.setenv(NOAWT=1) before loading the JGR package and run Sys.unsetenv("NOAWT") before starting JGR via JGR().

After installing and loading the RNetLogo package, define the file path where NetLogo is installed on your computer.

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, results = "hide"}
# install.packages("RNetLogo")

# GUI mode
# Sys.setenv(NOAWT=1)
# library(JGR)
# Sys.unsetenv("NOAWT")
# JGR()
# 
# # Non GUI
# Sys.setenv(NOAWT=1) 
# library(RNetLogo)
# NLStart(nl.path = "/Applications/NetLogo/NetLogo 5.3.1.app/", gui = FALSE)
```
